title: How to Bake a Raspberry and Cream Layered Cake

text: Making the Biscuit Base Preheat the oven to 175°C /350°F.  Mix the eggs with the sugar in a bowl.  Add and stir the flour, starch, almonds, melted butter, pinch of salt, baking powder and almond extract.  Bake the mix for about 28 to 30 minutes. Remove and allow to cool. Making the Filling Boil the juice, vanilla extract, cinnamon stick, sugar, starch, almond extract for 3 to 4 minutes.  Remove the cinnamon stick. Add the frozen raspberries. Putting the Cake Together Wait until the biscuit cooled off and cut it in two halves.  Spread the raspberry filling over one half of the biscuit. Put it in the fridge. Make the cream topping. Whip the cream. Stir together the mascarpone, curd, icing sugar. Add the whipped cream. Spread 50 percent of the mascarpone cream over the biscuit with the raspberries. Then put the second biscuit half on the top. Spread the remaining cream on the cake and put it in the fridge to chill and set.  Serve when set. Cut slices and serve on small plates. Finished.
